SEARCH
Module java.base
Package java.lang

Interface TemplatedString

public interface TemplatedString
TemplatedString is a preview API of the Java platform.
Programs can only use TemplatedString when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.
The Java compiler produces implementations of TemplatedStringPREVIEW to represent string templates and text block templates. Libraries may produce TemplatedStringPREVIEW instances as long as they conform to the requirements of this interface. Like String, instances of TemplatedStringPREVIEW implementations are considered immutable.

Implementations of this interface must minimally implement the methods fragments() and values().

The fragments() method must return an immutable List<String> consistent with the string template body. The list contains the string of characters preceeding each of the embedded expressions plus the string of characters following the last embedded expression. The order of the strings is left to right as they appear in the string template. For example; 

TemplatedString ts = "The \{name} and \{address} of the resident.";
List<String> fragments = ts.fragments();
fragments will be equivalent to List.of("The ", " and ", " of the resident.").

The values() method returns an immutable List<Object> of values accumulated by evaluating embedded expressions prior to instantiating the TemplatedStringPREVIEW. The values are accumulated left to right. The first element of the list is the result of the leftmost embedded expression. The last element of the list is the result of the rightmost embedded expression. For example, 

int x = 10;
int y = 20;
TemplatedString ts = "\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}";
List<Object> values = ts.values();
values will be the equivalent of List.of(x, y, x + y).

TemplatedStringsPREVIEW are primarily used in conjuction with TemplatePolicyPREVIEW to produce meaningful results. For example, if a user wants basic string concatenation, then they can use a string template expression with the standard STR policy. 

int x = 10;
int y = 20;
String result = STR."\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}";
result will be equivalent to "10 + 20 = 30".

The apply(java.lang.template.TemplatePolicy<R, E>) method supplies an alternative to using string template expressions. 

String result = "\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}".apply(STR);
In addition to string template expressions, the factory methods of(String) and of(List, List) can be used to construct TemplatedStringsPREVIEW. The TemplatedString.TemplateBuilderPREVIEW class can be used to construct TemplatedStringsPREVIEW from parts; string fragments, values and other TemplatedStringsPREVIEW.

The concat() method provides a simple way to perform basic string concatenation of the TemplatedStringPREVIEW.

Template policiesPREVIEW typically use the following pattern to perform concatenation: 

StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
Iterator<String> fragmentsIter = ts.fragments().iterator();

for (Object value : ts.values()) {
    sb.append(fragmentsIter.next());
    sb.append(value);
}

sb.append(fragmentsIter.next());
String result = sb.toString();
Implementation Requirements:
An instance of TemplatedStringPREVIEW is immutatble. Also, the fragment list size must be one more than the values list size.
Since:
20

  • Field Details

    • STR

      static final StringPolicyPREVIEW STR
      Simple concatenation policy instance. Example: 
      int x = 10;
int y = 20;
String result = STR."\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}";
      Implementation Note:
      The result of concatenation is not interned.

    • FMT

      static final FormatterPolicyPREVIEW FMT
      Predefined FormatterPolicy instance that uses Locale.US. Example: 
      int x = 123;
int y = 987;
String result = FMT."%3d\{x} + %3d\{y} = %4d\{x + y}";

  • Method Details

    • fragments

      List<String> fragments()
      Returns an immutable list of string fragments consisting of the string of characters preceeding each of the embedded expressions plus the string of characters following the last embedded expression. In the example: 
      TemplatedString ts = "The student \{student} is in \{teacher}'s class room.";
List<String> fragments = ts.fragments();
      fragments will be equivalent to List.of("The student ", " is in ", "'s class room.")
      Implementation Requirements:
      The list returned is immutable.
      Returns:
      list of string fragments

    • values

      List<Object> values()
      Returns an immutable list of embedded expression results. In the example: 
      TemplatedString templatedString = "\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}";
List<Object> values = templatedString.values();
      values will be equivalent to List.of(x, y, x + y)
      Implementation Requirements:
      The list returned is immutable.
      Returns:
      list of expression values

    • concat

      default String concat()
      Returns the basic concatenation of fragments and values.
      Returns:
      the basic concatenation of fragments and values

    • apply

      default <R, E extends Throwable> R apply(TemplatePolicyPREVIEW<R,E> policy) throws E
      Returns the result of applying the specified policy to this TemplatedStringPREVIEW. This method can be used as an alternative to string template expressions. For example, 
      String result1 = STR."\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}";
String result2 = "\{x} + \{y} = \{x + y}".apply(STR);
      produces an equivalent result for both result1 and result2.
      Implementation Note:
      The default implementation simply invokes the policy's apply method policy.apply(this).
      Type Parameters:
      R - Policy's apply result type.
      E - Exception thrown type.
      Parameters:
      policy - the TemplatePolicyPREVIEW instance to apply
      Returns:
      constructed object of type R
      Throws:
      E - exception thrown by the template policy when validation fails
      NullPointerException - if templatedString is null

    • toString

      static String toString(TemplatedStringPREVIEW templatedString)
      Produces a diagnostic string representing the supplied TemplatedStringPREVIEW.
      Parameters:
      templatedString - the TemplatedStringPREVIEW to represent
      Returns:
      diagnostic string representing the supplied templated string
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if templatedString is null

    • of

      static TemplatedStringPREVIEW of(String string)
      Returns a TemplatedString composed from a string.
      Parameters:
      string - single string fragment
      Returns:
      TemplatedString composed from string
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if string is null

    • of

      static TemplatedStringPREVIEW of(List<String> fragments, List<Object> values)
      Returns a TemplatedString composed from fragments and values.
      Implementation Requirements:
      The fragments list size must be one more that the values list size.
      Implementation Note:
      Contents of both lists are copied to construct immutable lists.
      Parameters:
      fragments - list of string fragments
      values - list of expression values
      Returns:
      TemplatedString composed from string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if fragments list size is not one more than values list size
      NullPointerException - if fragments or values is null

    • builder

      static TemplatedString.TemplateBuilderPREVIEW builder()
      Factory for creating a new TemplatedString.TemplateBuilderPREVIEW instance.
      Returns:
      a new TemplatedString.TemplateBuilderPREVIEW instance.
